title: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as unchanged even though it is dirtied.
OB: Opening a Java file and placing the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
EB: The Java file should not be marked as unchanged after using code assist.
SR:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider 'I' to be the cursor below:
Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press CtrlSpace to trigger code assist.
